intro: Phyteuma limonifolium, commonly known as lemonleaf phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of pale blue or purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct lemony scent, which gives it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
